    Statistics for one Hysteresis Loop

    vsm.hystStatsLoop.Rd

    Retrieve statistics for one loop, if you need to get statistics for all loops in the VSMdata object, then use vsm.hystStat() instead

    Retrieve statistics for one loop, if you need to get statistics for all loops in the VSMdata object, then use vsm.hystStat() instead

    vsm.hystStatsLoop(obj, loop = 1, direction = 1)

vsm.hystStatsLoop(obj, loop = 1, direction = 1)

    Arguments

    obj

    VSMdata object

    loop

    number of the loop

    direction

    +1 or -1 for direction of applied field

    Value

    list or NULL if not a "MvsH" type

    list or NULL if not a "MvsH" type

    Examples

    filename = vsm.getSampleFiles()[1]
d = vsm.import(filename)
vsm.hystStatsLoop(d)
#> $H.first
#> [1] -19852.77
#> 
#> $H.last
#> [1] 19999.11
#> 
#> $H.max
#> [1] 19999.11
#> 
#> $H.min
#> [1] -19852.77
#> 
#> $Ms1
#> [1] 8.630711e-05
#> 
#> $Ms1.sd
#> [1] 3.463391e-07
#> 
#> $Ms2
#> [1] -8.633927e-05
#> 
#> $Ms2.sd
#> [1] 5.919962e-07
#> 
#> $Hc
#> [1] 413.6
#> 
#> $Hc.err
#> [1] 76.4
#> 
#> $Hc.nFit
#> [1] 7
#> 
#> $Mrem
#> [1] -3.901093e-05
#> 
#> $Mrem.sd
#> [1] 1.778054e-06
#> 
#> $Susceptibility
#> [1] -4.879e-09
#> 
#> $Susceptibility.sd
#> [1] 3.171e-11
#> 
#> $T
#> [1] 2.999695
#> 
#> $T.sd
#> [1] 0.001849705
#> 
#> $speed
#> [1] 104.4547
#> 
#> $speed.sd
#> [1] 0.093174
#> 
#> $time.delta
#> [1] 397.88
#> 
#> $data.points
#> [1] 263
#> 
#> $dir
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $type
#> [1] "MvsH"
#> 
#> $loop
#> [1] 1
#> 

filename = vsm.getSampleFiles()[1]
d = vsm.import(filename)
vsm.hystStatsLoop(d)
#> $H.first
#> [1] -19852.77
#> 
#> $H.last
#> [1] 19999.11
#>
